trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of a Pilates program on balance, functional performance and quality of life in elderly people
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of a Pilates program on balance, functional performance and quality of life in elderly people aged between sixty and seventy-five years old

conditions.healthcondition: Balance, functional performance and quality of life in elderly people

interventions.interventions: It was two weekly sessions with duration of a hour each session. The session was divided in ten minutes of stretching exercises, fourty minutes of Pilates method exercises and finally, ten minutes of respiratory exercises for back to calm and relaxation (Intervention group). The intervention had a overall duration of 8 weeks (16 sessions in total). The intervention is administered to small groups of 3 participants.
interventions.comparator: The Control group, received a thirty minutes session with respiratory and relaxation exercises (active control). The intervention had a overall duration of 8 weeks (16 sessions in total) and twice a week.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The balance was evaluated through of Timed Up and Go and Tandem position tests.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The instruments and tests were applied before (baseline) and after treatment (8 weeks after baseline) to evaluate the balance.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The functional performance was evaluated through Sit-to-stand,functional scope and six meters walk distance tests.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The instruments and tests were applied before (baseline) and after treatment (8 weeks after baseline) to evaluate functional performance.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The people's quality of life was evaluated by medical outcomes Study 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey questionnaire (SF-36).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The instruments and tests were applied before (baseline) and after treatment (8 weeks after baseline) to evaluate quality of life.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Before the aplication of intervention in both groups, we applied a questionnaire with inclusion criterias of the study and personal informations such age, gender, ocupation, schooling, fall history, bone fractures and activies of daily living.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: The initial questionnaire was applied before the intervention in both groups (control and intervention groups).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: The inclusion criteria of our study were people aged between sixty and seventy five years old, living in Barao de Cocais, Minas Gerais.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The exclusion criteria of our study were: people can not use gait aid devices, they can not submit stroke, Parkinson's disease, Dementia and cognitive impairments.

trial_design.concealment: The participants were allocated in two groups: Intervention and Control groups through numbers conteiners. there are twelve participants in each group.
trial_design.sequence: The method used for allocate the participants was the simple randomization using procedures like dilce-rolling method.
